trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when a parse error occurs.
The HttpParseException class is an HTTP-specific exception class that enables ASP.NET to output parser exception information.
For more information on throwing and handling exceptions, see [Exceptions](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpParseException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpParseException"></xref> class with a specified error message.
The exception message to specify when the error occurs.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpParseException"></xref> class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner.
The exception message to specify when the error occurs.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

If the `innerException` parameter is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, the current exception is raised in a <xref uid="langword_csharp_catch" name="catch" href=""></xref> block that handles the inner exception.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpParseException"></xref> class with specific information about the source code being compiled and the line number on which the exception occurred.
The exception message to specify when the error occurs.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

If `innerException` is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, the current exception is raised in a <xref uid="langword_csharp_catch" name="catch" href=""></xref> block that handles the inner exception.
The virtual path for the exception.
The source code being compiled when the exception occurs.
The line number on which the exception occurred.
Gets the name of the file being parsed when the error occurs.
The FileName property returns the physical path to the source file that has the error unless the physical path is `null`, in which case it returns `null`.

The physical path to the source file that is being parsed when the error occurs; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, if the physical path is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, sets the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object with information about the exception.
The GetObjectData method sets a <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> object with all the exception object data targeted for serialization.
During deserialization, the exception is reconstituted from the SerializationInfo transmitted over the stream.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
The info parameter is .
Gets the number of the line being parsed when the error occurs.
The number of the line being parsed when the error occurs.
This value is 1-based, not 0-based.
Gets the parser errors for the current exception.
A collection of the parser errors for the current exception.
Gets the virtual path to source file that generated the error.
The virtual path to the source file that generated the error.
